intro: Tetrapterys squarrosa f. ovata, commonly known as the ovate-leaved tetrapterys, is a variant of the species Tetrapterys squarrosa, characterized by its ovate-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes plants such as hibiscus and cotton. The leaves are typically pubescent, with a distinctive squarrose arrangement of the terminal lobes. This plant is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and adaptation.
